alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 4:29PM EDT until June 17 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MONMOUTH AND SOUTHERN MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 428 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Dayton, or 9 miles south of New Brunswick, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Marlboro, Manalapan, Jamesburg, Cranbury, Roosevelt, Princeton Meadows, Kingston, Dayton, Robertsville, Clearbrook Park, Yorketown, Whittingham, Morganville, Brownville, Twin Rivers, Kendall Park and North Brunswick Township. This includes New Jersey Turnpike near exit 9. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
